snippet: The three employees who were indicted in connection with the oil spill are the faces of a renewed effort by the Justice Department to hold executives accountable for their actions.
abstract: Donald J Vidrine, Robert Kaluza and David Rainey, BP employees indicted for their part in the 2010 Deepwater Horizon disaster, have become the public face of renewed effort by Justice Department to hold executives accountable for their actions; executives Vidrine and Kaluza have been charged with manslaughter in the deaths of 11 fellow employees, while Rainey, a diver, is charged with obstruction of Congress related to his testimony following the spill.
lead_paragraph: The three employees who were indicted in connection with the oil spill are the faces of a renewed effort by the Justice Department to hold executives accountable for their actions.

headline.main: In BP Indictments, U.S. Shifts to Hold Individuals Accountable
headline.print_headline: In BP Indictments, U.S. Shifts to Hold Individuals Accountable
